1.title: Liverpool v Manchester United
1.plot: Liverpool built a 3-0 lead on the back of a Dirk Kuyt hat-trick, eventually defeating Manchester United 3-1.

2.title: Manchester City v Blackburn Rovers
2.plot: Dimitar Berbatov smashed home five goals to set Manchester United on their way to a 7-1 victory against a beleaguered Blackburn Rovers. Blackburn Rovers' defence was poor but they received no help from midfield.

3.title: Newcastle United v Arsenal
3.plot: Theo Walcott scored after 44 seconds before a Johan Djourou header and a strike from Robin van Persie put Arsenal 3-0 ahead inside 10 minutes. Newcastle were completely blown away during the opening half of the match but produced a stunning comeback from 4-0 down to earn a draw.

4.title: Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal
4.plot: The Gunners had stormed into a 3-1 lead after Theo Walcott, Samir Nasri and Robin van Persie all struck in the first half. Spurs were handed a golden chance to get back into the game when Szczesny tripped Lennon in the box in the 70th minute and Van der Vaart duly obliged, slotting home from 12 yards to make it 3-3.

5.title: Everton v Manchester United
5.plot: Manchester United were comfortably on course for a first away win of the season when leading 3-1 into stoppage-time, but two dramatic late goals earned Everton a draw.

6.title: Newcastle United v Sunderland
6.plot: Newcastle United destroyed their neighbours in the Tyne-Wear derby, securing a 5-1 victory over Sunderland. Kevin Nolan grabbed a hat-trick as Shola Ameobi scored twice for the Magpies. Former Newcastle United defender Titus Bramble was sent off as the hosts went on to complete a rout.

7.title: Everton v Blackpool
7.plot: Louis Saha was the star of the show as he hit four goals in an eight-goal thriller as Everton defeated Blackpool 5-3 at Goodison Park.

8.title: West Bromwich Albion v West Ham United
8.plot: Goals by Graham Dorrans, Jerome Thomas and an own goal by Winston Reid saw the Baggies take command of the game before a remarkable second-half comeback by the Hammers with a double from January signing Demba Ba and a simple header for Carlton Cole made it 3-3.

9.title: Wolverhampton Wanderers v Blackburn Rovers
9.plot: Blackburn Rovers beat Wolverhampton Wanderers 3-2 at Molineux on an afternoon of incredible drama which saw both sides preserve their Premier League status.

10.title: Fulham v Liverpool
10.plot: A Maxi Rodriguez hat-trick set Liverpool on course for a thrilling 5-2 win at Fulham. Liverpool played with hunger, intelligence and devastating simplicity of movement to shred Fulham's good home record.

imdb.title: Premier League Classic Matches 2010/2011
plot: 10 Premier League Classic Matches from 2010/2011 Season
